issue.title: Can Callable's function object be an rvalue?

discussion.p: In Callable: can the F, the first argument of operator(), be an rvalue? If so, what's the language rule that gives us a yes answer? If not, is it ok to rule that out? (General theme for many of our questions: what is the criterion we use, when we define a concept, to decide whether the concept's functions should take their argument by value, by const reference, by non-const reference, by rvalue reference, or whatever?)
Note: The function object cannot be an rvalue.
